meanings.definition: A person who participates in an activity in a casual or superficial way.
meanings.sent1: The dabblers in the art class only painted once in a while.
meanings.sent2: The group of dabblers joined the hiking club but rarely went on hikes.
meanings.sent3: The dabblers in the cooking class often ended up ordering takeout instead.
meanings.sent4: She was a dabbler in gardening, planting a few flowers here and there.
meanings.sent5: The dabblers in the book club never finished reading the assigned books.

meanings.definition: A type of duck that feeds by dabbling in shallow water.
meanings.sent1: The dabblers waddled into the pond to search for food.
meanings.sent2: The colorful dabblers swam gracefully in the lake.
meanings.sent3: The dabblers quacked happily as they splashed around in the water.
meanings.sent4: The dabblers moved their beaks swiftly to catch insects in the water.
meanings.sent5: The dabblers' feathers glistened in the sunlight as they dabbled in the pond.

meanings.definition: A person who dabbles in painting or other artistic pursuits.
meanings.sent1: The young dabblers in the art studio experimented with different colors.
meanings.sent2: The group of dabblers gathered to sketch landscapes in the park.
meanings.sent3: The dabblers giggled as they accidentally mixed all the paint colors together.
meanings.sent4: She was a dabbler in photography, capturing moments with her camera.
meanings.sent5: The dabblers' artwork adorned the walls of the local gallery.
